conclusion: Analyze the flow of liquid from sources A, B, C, and D to determine which container (E, F, or G) it will end up in.
Liquid from source A (cyan color) flows down the first baffle and follows the green baffle towards the left side.
Liquid from source A ends up in container E.
Liquid from source B (yellow color) flows down the second baffle and follows the purple baffle towards the right side.
Liquid from source B ends up in container G.
Liquid from source C (orange color) flows down the third baffle and follows the black baffle towards the center.
Liquid from source C ends up in container F.
Liquid from source D (pink color) flows directly down without hitting any baffles.
Liquid from source D ends up in container F.
Final answer: Liquid from A flows into container E, liquid from B flows into container G, liquid from C flows into container F, and liquid from D flows into container F.
